subNodes.conversationText: root

From under the roots of the dead tree, you hear a groaning noise and see a figure weakly throwing the wooden prison. The figure is pale and thin, but looks and sounds like it is still alive. Clearly Kolgoth had not had time to fully drain this one. It walks toward you, and you let out a small cry of surprise.
"...Vinazl?"
Vinazl the Wizard stands in front of you. He is swaying a little, but his eyes are sharp. "It seems I owe you my thanks. I had no wish to finish up as one of those things."
".... but...but..." You find it difficult to explain your question.
Vinazl nods. "Yes. I, the mighty Vinazl, owe you a debt of thanks. I will do something for you in return. You must just name it."
"Its just that... well, I saw you die."
"Erm, no? I'm not dead. You don't have to worry about me turning into one of those things. You reached me in time!"
"No, earlier I mean. You turned to dust."
"I did not!" Vinazl says indignantly.
"You did!"
"I did not! I would remember such a thing. Or, maybe I wouldn't, but I wouldn't be here, would I?"
"I was in your underground lair, and I saw you turn to dust."

Vinazl's eyes open wide. "In my home? How did you get past the golem? How did you even open the door?" 

He pauses for a moment and then starts laughing. "Oh, I see now!"
"What's so funny?"

"I have a simulcrum... you know what this is, no? It is like a golem, but human in form. It resembles its creator - in this case, me. The magic binding it needs to be remade regularly or it turns back into dust. Since I've been busy here, it will have been deteriorating."
"It thought it was you."

"Yes, well. It was meant to be a distraction for whatever evil was in the forest, so it needed to think it was me. It had no real magic though, only parlour tricks. Anyway, enough of this! You must tell me what I can do for you."
"I want to leave the forest."

Vinazl smiles. "Now that my hands are free, that one I can do. Although first I need to speak to you about a matter of some... sensitivity."

His gaze falls darkly on Bathak, who is lurking towards the rear, keeping closely to the shadows.
"Go on."
Vinazl takes you to one side. "Your companion. Are you aware that it is a Homunklus? They are evil creature that feast on the flesh and souls of the living."
Continue.

"It will have made a deal with you, I'm sure. Perhaps several by now. I offer you  one piece of advice - break your oaths. Make sure that it does not leave the forest alive, or the people around the Raventhal will suffer greatly."
"I'll consider what you say."

"I can ask no more from you. I will not force the issue, since I owe you my life." Vinzal nods sadly, and claps his hands. There is a sudden flash of light. When your eyes recover, you see that you are somewhere else entirely.
Continue.

Continue.
